   1import numpy as np

   3from PyQt5.QtCore import Qt, QPointF, QRectF
   4from PyQt5.QtGui import QColor, QPen, QBrush, QPolygonF, QFont, QPainterPath, QTransform
   5from PyQt5.QtWidgets import QAbstractGraphicsShapeItem, QGraphicsItem, QGraphicsItemGroup, QGraphicsTextItem, QGraphicsLineItem, QGraphicsEllipseItem, QGraphicsPolygonItem, QGraphicsRectItem, QGraphicsPathItem

   7# === ITEMS ================================================================
   8
   9# --- Generic Item ---------------------------------------------------------
  10
  11class item():
  12  """
  13  Item of the animation (generic class)
  14
  15  Items are the elements displayed in the :py:attr:`Animation2d.Qscene`. 
  16  This class provides a common constructor, conversions of positions
  17  to scene coordinates and styling of ``QAbstractGraphicsShapeItem`` 
  18  children.
  19
  20  Attr:
  21
  22    animation (:class:`Animation2d`): Parent animation.
  23
  24    name (str): Unique identifier of the item.
  25
  26    parent (:class:`item` *subclass*): Parent item, if any.
  27
  28    position ([float, float]): Position of the item. See each subclass for
  29      details.
  30
  31    zvalue (float): Z-value (stack order).
  32  """
  33
  34  def __init__(self, animation, name, **kwargs):
  35    """
  36    Generic item constructor
  37
  38    Args:
  39
  40      animation (:class:`Animaton2d`): The animation container.
  41
  42      name (str): Name of the item. It should be unique, as it is used as an
  43        identifier in the :py:attr:`Animation2d.item` dict.
  44
  45      parent (*QGraphicsItem*): The parent ``QGraphicsItem``.
  46
  47      zvalue (float): Z-value (stack order).
  48
  49      position ([float, float]): Position of the item. See each item's 
  50        documentation for a description.
  51
  52      draggable (bool): If True, the element will be draggable. (default: ``False``)
  53
  54      clickable (bool): *TO DO*
  55    """  
  56
  57    # Call the other item's constructor, if any
  58    super().__init__()
  59
  60    # --- Definitions
  61
  62    # Reference animation
  63    self.animation = animation
  64
  65    # Assign name
  66    self.name = name
  67
  68    self._parent = None
  69    self._behindParent = None
  70    self._position = [0,0]
  71    self._shift = [0,0]
  72    self._transformPoint = [0,0]
  73    self._orientation = None
  74    self._scale = None
  75    self._zvalue = None
  76    self._draggable = None
  77      
  78    # --- Initialization
  79
  80    if 'parent' in kwargs: self.parent = kwargs['parent']
  81    if 'behindParent' in kwargs: self.behindParent = kwargs['behindParent']
  82    if 'position' in kwargs: self.position = kwargs['position']
  83    if 'transformPoint' in kwargs: self.transformPoint = kwargs['transformPoint']
  84    if 'orientation' in kwargs: self.orientation = kwargs['orientation']
  85    if 'scale' in kwargs: self.scale = kwargs['scale']
  86    if 'zvalue' in kwargs: self.zvalue = kwargs['zvalue']
  87    if 'draggable' in kwargs: self.draggable = kwargs['draggable']
  88
  89  def x2scene(self, x):
  90    """
  91    Convert the :math:`x` position in scene coordinates
  92
  93    arg:
  94      x (float): The :math:`x` position.
  95
  96    returns:
  97      The :math:`x` position in scene coordinates.
  98    """
  99    if self.parent is None:
 100      return (x-self.animation.boundaries['x'][0])*self.animation.factor
 101    else:
 102      return x*self.animation.factor
 103
 104  def y2scene(self, y):
 105    """
 106    Convert the :math:`y` position in scene coordinates
 107
 108    arg:
 109      y (float): The :math:`y` position.
 110
 111    returns:
 112      The :math:`y` position in scene coordinates.
 113    """
 114    
 115    if self.parent is None:
 116      return (self.animation.boundaries['y'][0]-y)*self.animation.factor
 117    else:
 118      return -y*self.animation.factor
 119
 120  def xy2scene(self, xy):
 121    """
 122    Convert the :math:`x` and :math:`y` positions in scene coordinates
 123
 124    arg:
 125      xy ([float,float]): The :math:`x` and :math:`y` positions.
 126
 127    returns:
 128      The :math:`x` and :math:`y` position in scene coordinates.
 129    """
 130
 131    return self.x2scene(xy[0]), self.y2scene(xy[1])
 132
 133  def d2scene(self, d):
 134    """
 135    Convert a distance in scene coordinates
 136
 137    arg:
 138      d (float): Distance to convert.
 139
 140    returns:
 141      The distance in scene coordinates.
 142    """
 143
 144    return d*self.animation.factor
 145
 146  def a2scene(self, a):
 147    """
 148    Convert an angle in scene coordinates (radian to degrees)
 149
 150    arg:
 151      a (float): Angle to convert.
 152
 153    returns:
 154      The angle in degrees.
 155    """
 156
 157    return -a*180/np.pi
 158  
 159  def scene2x(self, u):
 160    """
 161    Convert horizontal scene coordinates into :math:`x` position
 162
 163    arg:
 164      u (float): The horizontal coordinate.
 165
 166    returns:
 167      The :math:`x` position.
 168    """
 169
 170    if self._parent is None:
 171      return self.animation.boundaries['x'][0] + u/self.animation.factor
 172    else:
 173      return u/self.animation.factor
 174
 175  def scene2y(self, v):
 176    """
 177    Convert vertical scene coordinates into :math:`y` position
 178
 179    arg:
 180      v (float): The horizontal coordinate.
 181
 182    returns:
 183      The :math:`y` position.
 184    """
 185
 186    if self._parent is None:
 187      return self.animation.boundaries['y'][0] - v/self.animation.factor
 188    else:
 189      return -v/self.animation.factor
 190
 191  def scene2xy(self, pos):
 192    """
 193    Convert scene coordinates into :math:`x` and :math:`y` positions
 194
 195    arg:
 196      pos ([float,float]): The position in scene coordinates.
 197
 198    returns:
 199      The :math:`x` and :math:`y` positions.
 200    """
 201
 202    if isinstance(pos, QPointF):
 203      u = pos.x()
 204      v = pos.y()
 205    else:
 206      u = pos[0]
 207      v = pos[1]
 208
 209    return self.scene2x(u), self.scene2y(v)
 210
 211  def scene2d(self, d):
 212   
 213    return d/self.animation.factor
 214
 215  def width(self):
 216
 217    if isinstance(self, group):
 218      bRect = self.childrenBoundingRect()
 219    else:
 220      bRect = self.boundingRect()
 221
 222    return bRect.width()/self.animation.factor
 223
 224  def height(self):
 225
 226    if isinstance(self, group):      
 227      bRect = self.childrenBoundingRect()
 228    else:
 229      bRect = self.boundingRect()
 230
 231    return bRect.height()/self.animation.factor
 232
 233  def place(self):
 234    """
 235    Absolute positionning
 236
 237    Places the item at an absolute position.
 238    
 239    Attributes:
 240      x (float): :math:`x`-coordinate of the new position. It can also be a 
 241        doublet [``x``,``y``], in this case the *y* argument is 
 242        overridden.
 243      y (float): :math:`y`-coordinate of the new position.
 244      z (float): A complex number :math:`z = x+jy`. Specifying ``z``
 245        overrides the ``x`` and ``y`` arguments.
 246    """
 247
 248    # Set position
 249    self.setPos(self.x2scene(self._position[0])-self._shift[0], 
 250      self.y2scene(self._position[1])-self._shift[1])
 251
 252  def move(self, dx=None, dy=None, z=None):
 253    """
 254    Relative displacement
 255
 256    Displaces the item of relative amounts.
 257    
 258    Attributes:
 259      dx (float): :math:`x`-coordinate of the displacement. It can also be a 
 260        doublet [`dx`,`dy`], in this case the *dy* argument is overridden.
 261      dy (float): :math:`y`-coordinate of the displacement.
 262      z (float): A complex number :math:`z = dx+jdy`. Specifying ``z``
 263        overrides the ``x`` and ``y`` arguments.
 264    """
 265
 266    # Doublet input
 267    if isinstance(dx, (tuple, list)):
 268      dy = dx[1]
 269      dx = dx[0]  
 270
 271    # Convert from complex coordinates
 272    if z is not None:
 273      dx = np.real(z)
 274      dy = np.imag(z)
 275
 276    # Store position
 277    if dx is not None: self._position[0] += dx
 278    if dy is not None: self._position[1] += dy
 279
 280    self.place()
 281
 282  def rotate(self, angle):
 283    """
 284    Relative rotation
 285
 286    Rotates the item relatively to its current orientation.
 287    
 288    Attributes:
 289      angle (float): Orientational increment (rad)
 290    """
 291
 292    self._orientation += angle
 293    self.setRotation(self.a2scene(self.orientation))
 294
 295  def setStyle(self):
 296    """
 297    Item styling
 298
 299    This function does not take any argument, instead it applies the changes
 300    defined by each item's styling attributes (*e.g.* color, stroke thickness).
 301    """
 302
 303    # --- Fill
 304
 305    if isinstance(self, QAbstractGraphicsShapeItem):
 306
 307      if self._color['fill'] is not None:
 308        self.setBrush(QBrush(QColor(self._color['fill'])))
 309
 310    # --- Stroke
 311
 312    if isinstance(self, (QAbstractGraphicsShapeItem,QGraphicsLineItem)):
 313
 314      Pen = QPen()
 315
 316      #  Color
 317      if self._color['stroke'] is not None:
 318        Pen.setColor(QColor(self._color['stroke']))
 319
 320      # Thickness
 321      if self._thickness is not None:
 322        Pen.setWidth(self._thickness)
 323
 324      # Style
 325      match self._linestyle:
 326        case 'dash' | '--': Pen.setDashPattern([3,6])
 327        case 'dot' | ':' | '..': Pen.setStyle(Qt.DotLine)
 328        case 'dashdot' | '-.': Pen.setDashPattern([3,3,1,3])
 329      
 330      self.setPen(Pen)
 331
 332  def mousePressEvent(self, event):
 333    """
 334    Simple click event
 335
 336    For internal use only.
 337
 338    args:
 339      event (QGraphicsSceneMouseEvent): The click event.
 340    """
 341
 342    match event.button():
 343      case 1: type = 'leftclick'
 344      case 2: type = 'rightclick'
 345      case 4: type = 'middleclick'
 346      case 8: type = 'sideclick'
 347
 348    self.animation.change(type, self)
 349    super().mousePressEvent(event)
 350
 351  def mouseDoubleClickEvent(self, event):
 352    """
 353    Double click event
 354
 355    For internal use only.
 356
 357    args:
 358      event (QGraphicsSceneMouseEvent): The double click event.
 359    """
 360
 361    self.animation.change('doubleclick', self)
 362    super().mousePressEvent(event)
 363
 364  def itemChange(self, change, value):
 365    """
 366    Item change notification
 367
 368    This method is triggered upon item change. The item's transformation
 369    matrix has changed either because setTransform is called, or one of the
 370    transformation properties is changed. This notification is sent if the 
 371    ``ItemSendsGeometryChanges`` flag is enabled (e.g. when an item is 
 372    :py:attr:`item.movable`), and after the item's local transformation 
 373    matrix has changed.
 374
 375    args:
 376
 377      change (QGraphicsItem constant): 
 378
 379    """
 380    # -- Define type
 381
 382    type = None
 383
 384    match change:
 385      case QGraphicsItem.ItemPositionHasChanged:
 386        type = 'move'
 387
 388    # Report to animation
 389    if type is not None:
 390      self.animation.change(type, self)
 391
 392    # Propagate change
 393    return super().itemChange(change, value)
 394
 395  # --- Parent -------------------------------------------------------------
 396
 397  @property
 398  def parent(self): return self._parent
 399
 400  @parent.setter
 401  def parent(self, pName):
 402    self._parent = pName
 403    self.setParentItem(self.animation.item[self._parent])
 404
 405  # --- belowParent --------------------------------------------------------
 406
 407  @property
 408  def behindParent(self): return self._behindParent
 409
 410  @behindParent.setter
 411  def behindParent(self, b):
 412    self._behindParent = b
 413    self.setFlag(QGraphicsItem.ItemStacksBehindParent, b)
 414
 415  # --- Position -------------------------------------------------------------
 416
 417  @property
 418  def position(self): return self._position
 419
 420  @position.setter
 421  def position(self, pos):
 422    
 423    if isinstance(pos, complex):
 424
 425      # Convert from complex coordinates
 426      x = np.real(pos)
 427      y = np.imag(pos)
 428
 429    else:
 430
 431      # Doublet input
 432      x = pos[0]  
 433      y = pos[1]      
 434
 435    # Store position
 436    self._position = [x,y]
 437
 438    # Set position
 439    self.place()    
 440
 441  # --- Transform point ----------------------------------------------------
 442
 443  @property
 444  def transformPoint(self): return self._transformPoint
 445
 446  @transformPoint.setter
 447  def transformPoint(self, pt):
 448    
 449    if isinstance(pt, complex):
 450
 451      # Convert from complex coordinates
 452      x = np.real(pt)
 453      y = np.imag(pt)
 454
 455    else:
 456
 457      # Doublet input
 458      x = pt[0]  
 459      y = pt[1]      
 460
 461    # Store transform point
 462    self._transformPoint = [x,y]
 463
 464    # Set transform point
 465    self.setTransformOriginPoint(self.x2scene(x), self.y2scene(y))    
 466
 467  # --- Orientation --------------------------------------------------------
 468
 469  @property
 470  def orientation(self): return self._orientation
 471
 472  @orientation.setter
 473  def orientation(self, angle):
 474    self._orientation = angle
 475    self.setRotation(self.a2scene(angle))
 476
 477  # --- Scale --------------------------------------------------------
 478
 479  @property
 480  def scale(self): return self._scale
 481
 482  @scale.setter
 483  def scale(self, scale):
 484    self._scale = scale
 485    self.setTransform(QTransform.fromScale(scale[0], scale[1]), True)
 486
 487  # --- Z-value ------------------------------------------------------------
 488
 489  @property
 490  def zvalue(self): return self._zvalue
 491
 492  @zvalue.setter
 493  def zvalue(self, z):
 494    self._zvalue = z
 495    self.setZValue(self._zvalue)
 496
 497  # --- Draggability -------------------------------------------------------
 498
 499  @property
 500  def draggable(self): return self._draggable
 501
 502  @draggable.setter
 503  def draggable(self, z):
 504    
 505    self._draggable = z
 506    
 507    self.setFlag(QGraphicsItem.ItemIsMovable, self._draggable)
 508    self.setFlag(QGraphicsItem.ItemSendsGeometryChanges, self._draggable)
 509    if self._draggable:
 510      self.setCacheMode(QGraphicsItem.DeviceCoordinateCache)
 511    
 512# --- Group ----------------------------------------------------------------
 513
 514class group(item, QGraphicsItemGroup):
 515  """
 516  Group item
 517
 518  A group item has no representation upon display but serves as a parent for
 519  multiple other items in order to create and manipulate composed objects.  
 520  """
 521
 522  def __init__(self, animation, name, **kwargs):
 523    """
 524    Group item constructor
 525
 526    Defines a group, which inherits both from ``QGraphicsItemGroup`` and
 527    :class:`item`.
 528
 529    Args:
 530
 531      animation (:class:`Animaton2d`): The animation container.
 532
 533      name (str): The item's identifier, which should be unique. It is used as a
 534        reference by :class:`Animation2d`. This is the only mandatory argument.
 535
 536      parent (*QGraphicsItem*): The parent ``QGraphicsItem`` in the ``QGraphicsScene``.
 537        Default is ``None``, which means the parent is the ``QGraphicsScene`` itself.
 538
 539      zvalue (float): Z-value (stack order) of the item.
 540
 541      position ([float,float]): Position of the ``group``, ``text``, 
 542        ``circle``, and ``rectangle`` elements (scene units).
 543
 544      orientation (float): Orientation of the item (rad)
 545
 546      clickable (bool): *TO DO*
 547
 548      movable (bool): If True, the element will be draggable. (default: ``False``)
 549    """  
 550
 551    # Generic item constructor
 552    super().__init__(animation, name, **kwargs)
 553

 556class text(item, QGraphicsTextItem):
 557  """
 558  Text item
 559
 560  The ellipse is defined by it's :py:attr:`ellipse.major` and :py:attr:`ellipse.minor`
 561  axis lenghts, and by its position and orientation. The position of the 
 562  center is set by :py:attr:`item.position` and the orientation ... *TO WRITE*.
 563  
 564  Attributes:
 565
 566    major (float): Length of the major axis.
 567
 568    minor (float): Length of the minor axis.
 569  """
 570
 571  def __init__(self, animation, name, **kwargs):
 572    """
 573    Text item constructor
 574
 575    Defines a textbox, which inherits both from ``QGraphicsEllipseItem`` and
 576    :class:`item`.
 577
 578    Args:
 579
 580      animation (:class:`Animaton2d`): The animation container.
 581
 582      name (str): The item's identifier, which should be unique. It is used as a
 583        reference by :class:`Animation2d`. This is the only mandatory argument.
 584
 585      parent (*QGraphicsItem*): The parent ``QGraphicsItem`` in the ``QGraphicsScene``.
 586        Default is ``None``, which means the parent is the ``QGraphicsScene`` itself.
 587
 588      zvalue (float): Z-value (stack order) of the item.
 589
 590      orientation (float): Orientation of the item (rad)
 591
 592      position ([float,float]): Position of the ``group``, ``text``, 
 593        ``circle``, and ``rectangle`` elements (scene units).
 594
 595      colors ([*color*, *color*]): Fill and stroke colors for ``circle``, 
 596        ``ellipse``, ``rectangle`` or ``polygon`` elements.  Colors can be 
 597        whatever input of ``QColor`` (*e.g*: ``darkCyan``, ``#ff112233`` or 
 598        (255, 0, 0, 127))
 599
 600      linestyle (str): Stroke style (for ``circle``, ``ellipse``, ``rectangle``
 601        or ``p    
 602      clickable (bool): *TO DO*
 603
 604      movable (bool): If True, the element will be draggable. (default: ``False``)
 605    """  
 606
 607    # Generic item constructor
 608    super().__init__(animation, name, **kwargs)
 609    
 610    # --- Definitions
 611  
 612    self._string = None
 613    self._color = None
 614    self._fontname = 'Arial'
 615    self._fontsize = 12
 616    self._center = (True, True)
 617    
 618    # --- Initialization
 619
 620    self.string = kwargs['string'] if 'string' in kwargs else '-'
 621    self.color = kwargs['color'] if 'color' in kwargs else 'white'
 622    if 'fontname' in kwargs: self.fontname = kwargs['fontname']
 623    if 'fontsize' in kwargs: self.fontsize = kwargs['fontsize']
 624    if 'center' in kwargs: self.center = kwargs['center'] 
 625

 628  @property
 629  def string(self): return self._string

 632  def string(self, s):
 633    self._string = s
 634    self.setHtml(s)

 664    self.setFont((QFont(self._fontname, self._fontsize)))

 666  # --- Center -------------------------------------------------------------
 667
 668  @property
 669  def center(self): return self._center
 670
 671  @center.setter
 672  def center(self, C):
 673
 674    if isinstance(C, bool):
 675      self._center = (C,C)
 676    else:
 677      self._center = C
 678
 679    self._shift = [0,0]
 680    if self._center[0] or self._center[1]:
 681      
 682      bb = self.boundingRect()
 683
 684      if self.center[0]:
 685        self._shift[0] = bb.width()/2
 686      if self._center[1]:
 687        self._shift[1] = bb.height()/2
 688
 689    self.place()
 690

 693class ellipse(item, QGraphicsEllipseItem):
 694  """
 695  Ellipse item
 696
 697  The ellipse is defined by it's :py:attr:`ellipse.major` and :py:attr:`ellipse.minor`
 698  axis lenghts, and by its position and orientation. The position of the 
 699  center is set by :py:attr:`item.position` and the orientation ... *TO WRITE*.
 700  
 701  Attributes:
 702
 703    major (float): Length of the major axis.
 704
 705    minor (float): Length of the minor axis.
 706  """
 707
 708  def __init__(self, animation, name, **kwargs):
 709    """
 710    Ellipse item constructor
 711
 712    Defines an ellipse, which inherits both from ``QGraphicsEllipseItem`` and
 713    :class:`item`.
 714
 715    Args:
 716
 717      animation (:class:`Animaton2d`): The animation container.
 718
 719      name (str): The item's identifier, which should be unique. It is used as a
 720        reference by :class:`Animation2d`. This is the only mandatory argument.
 721
 722      parent (*QGraphicsItem*): The parent ``QGraphicsItem`` in the ``QGraphicsScene``.
 723        Default is ``None``, which means the parent is the ``QGraphicsScene`` itself.
 724
 725      zvalue (float): Z-value (stack order) of the item.
 726
 727      orientation (float): Orientation of the item (rad)
 728
 729      position ([float,float]): Position of the ``group``, ``text``, 
 730        ``circle``, and ``rectangle`` elements (scene units).
 731
 732      colors ([*color*, *color*]): Fill and stroke colors for ``circle``, 
 733        ``ellipse``, ``rectangle`` or ``polygon`` elements.  Colors can be 
 734        whatever input of ``QColor`` (*e.g*: ``darkCyan``, ``#ff112233`` or 
 735        (255, 0, 0, 127))
 736
 737      linestyle (str): Stroke style (for ``circle``, ``ellipse``, ``rectangle``
 738        or ``polygon``). Can have any value among ``solid`` (default), ``dash``
 739        or ``--``, ``dot`` or ``..`` or ``:``, ``dashdot`` or ``-.``.
 740
 741      clickable (bool): *TO DO*
 742
 743      movable (bool): If True, the element will be draggable. (default: ``False``)
 744    """  
 745
 746    # Generic item constructor
 747    super().__init__(animation, name, **kwargs)
 748    
 749    # --- Definitions
 750
 751    self._major = None
 752    self._minor = None
 753    self._color = (None, None)
 754    self._thickness = None
 755    self._linestyle = None
 756    self._span = None
 757
 758    # --- Initialization
 759
 760    if 'major' not in kwargs or 'minor' not in kwargs:
 761      raise AttributeError("'major' and 'minor' must be specified for ellipse items.")
 762    else:
 763      self.major = kwargs['major']
 764      self.minor = kwargs['minor']
 765
 766    self.colors = kwargs['colors'] if 'colors' in kwargs else ['gray','white']
 767    self.linestyle = kwargs['linestyle'] if 'linestyle' in kwargs else None
 768    self.thickness = kwargs['thickness'] if 'thickness' in kwargs else 0   
 769    self.span = kwargs['span'] if 'span' in kwargs else None
 770
 771  # --- Major axis length --------------------------------------------------
 772
 773  @property
 774  def major(self): return self._major
 775
 776  @major.setter
 777  def major(self, major):
 778
 779    self._major = major
 780
 781    if self._minor is not None:
 782
 783      # Conversion
 784      M = self.d2scene(self._major)
 785      m = self.d2scene(self._minor)
 786
 787      # Set geometry
 788      self.setRect(QRectF(-M/2, -m/2, M, m))
 789
 790  # --- Minor axis length --------------------------------------------------
 791
 792  @property
 793  def minor(self): return self._minor
 794
 795  @minor.setter
 796  def minor(self, minor):
 797
 798    self._minor = minor
 799
 800    # Conversion
 801    M = self.d2scene(self._major)
 802    m = self.d2scene(self._minor)
 803
 804    # Set geometry
 805    self.setRect(QRectF(-M/2, -m/2, M, m))
 806
 807  # --- Colors -------------------------------------------------------------
 808
 809  @property
 810  def colors(self): return self._color
 811
 812  @colors.setter
 813  def colors(self, C):
 814    self._color = {'fill': C[0], 'stroke': C[1]}
 815    self.setStyle()
 816
 817  # --- Thickness ----------------------------------------------------------
 818
 819  @property
 820  def thickness(self): return self._thickness
 821
 822  @thickness.setter
 823  def thickness(self, t):
 824    self._thickness = t
 825    self.setStyle()
 826
 827  # --- Linestyle ----------------------------------------------------------
 828
 829  @property
 830  def linestyle(self): return self._linestyle
 831
 832  @linestyle.setter
 833  def linestyle(self, s):
 834    self._linestyle = s
 835    self.setStyle()      
 836
 837 # --- Span ----------------------------------------------------------------
 838
 839  @property
 840  def span(self): return self._span
 841
 842  @span.setter
 843  def span(self, span):
 844    self._span = span
 845    if span is None:
 846      self.setStartAngle(0)
 847      self.setSpanAngle(5760)
 848    else:
 849      self.setStartAngle(int(span[0]*2880/np.pi))
 850      self.setSpanAngle(int(span[1]*2880/np.pi))

 899        or ``polygon``). Can have any value among ``solid`` (default), ``dash``

 995  center is set by :py:attr:`item.position` and the orientation ... *TO WRITE*.

 998
 999    major (float): Length of the major axis.
1000
1001    minor (float): Length of the minor axis.
1002  """
1003
1004  def __init__(self, animation, name, **kwargs):
1005    """
1006    Rectangle item constructor
1007
1008    Defines an ellipse, which inherits both from ``QGraphicsEllipseItem`` and
1009    :class:`item`.
1010
1011    Args:
1012
1013      animation (:class:`Animaton2d`): The animation container.

1016        reference by :class:`Animation2d`. This is the only mandatory argument.
1017
1018      parent (*QGraphicsItem*): The parent ``QGraphicsItem`` in the ``QGraphicsScene``.
1019        Default is ``None``, which means the parent is the ``QGraphicsScene`` itself.
1020
1021      zvalue (float): Z-value (stack order) of the item.
1022
1023      orientation (float): Orientation of the item (rad)
1024
1025      position ([float,float]): Position of the ``group``, ``text``, 
1026        ``circle``, and ``rectangle`` elements (scene units).
1027
1028      colors ([*color*, *color*]): Fill and stroke colors for ``circle``, 
1029        ``ellipse``, ``rectangle`` or ``polygon`` elements.  Colors can be 
1030        whatever input of ``QColor`` (*e.g*: ``darkCyan``, ``#ff112233`` or 
1031        (255, 0, 0, 127))
1032
1033      linestyle (str): Stroke style (for ``circle``, ``ellipse``, ``rectangle``
1034        or ``polygon``). Can have any value among ``solid`` (default), ``dash``
1035        or ``--``, ``dot`` or ``..`` or ``:``, ``dashdot`` or ``-.``.
1036
1037      clickable (bool): *TO DO*
1038
1039      movable (bool): If True, the element will be draggable. (default: ``False``)
1040    """  
1041
1042    # Generic item constructor
1043    super().__init__(animation, name, **kwargs)
1044    
1045    # --- Definitions
1046
1047    self._width = None
1048    self._height = None
1049    self._center = (True, True)
1050    self._color = (None, None)
1051    self._thickness = None
1052    self._linestyle = None
1053
1054    # --- Initialization
1055
1056    if 'width' not in kwargs or 'height' not in kwargs:
1057      raise AttributeError("'width' and 'height' must be specified for rectangle items.")
1058    else:
1059      self.width = kwargs['width']
1060      self.height = kwargs['height']
1061
1062    if 'center' in kwargs: self.center = kwargs['center']
1063    self.colors = kwargs['colors'] if 'colors' in kwargs else ['gray','white']
1064    self.linestyle = kwargs['linestyle'] if 'linestyle' in kwargs else None
1065    self.thickness = kwargs['thickness'] if 'thickness' in kwargs else 0   
1066
1067  def setGeometry(self):
1068
1069    # Conversion
1070    W = self.d2scene(self._width)
1071    H = self.d2scene(self._height)
1072
1073    dx = 0
1074    dy = 0
1075    if self._center[0] or self._center[1]:
1076      
1077      bb = self.boundingRect()
1078      if self._center[0]: dx = -W/2
1079      if self._center[1]: dy = H/2
1080
1081    # Set geometry
1082    self.setRect(QRectF(dx, dy, W, -H))
1083
1084  # --- Width --------------------------------------------------------------
1085
1086  @property

1088
1089  @width.setter
1090  def width(self, w):
1091
1092    self._width = w
1093    if self._height is not None: self.setGeometry()
1094      
1095  # --- Height -------------------------------------------------------------
1096
1097  @property
1098  def height(self): return self._height
1099
1100  @height.setter
1101  def height(self, h):
1102
1103    self._height = h
1104    self.setGeometry()    
1105
1106  # --- Center -------------------------------------------------------------
1107
1108  @property
1109  def center(self): return self._center
1110
1111  @center.setter
1112  def center(self, C):
1113
1114    if isinstance(C, bool):
1115      self._center = (C,C)
1116    else:
1117      self._center = C
1118
1119    self.setGeometry()
1120
1121  # --- Colors -------------------------------------------------------------
1122
1123  @property
1124  def colors(self): return self._color
1125
1126  @colors.setter
1127  def colors(self, C):
1128    self._color = {'fill': C[0], 'stroke': C[1]}
1129    self.setStyle()
1130
1131  # --- Thickness ----------------------------------------------------------

1133  @property
1134  def thickness(self): return self._thickness

1139    self.setStyle()
1140

1465
1466    self.colors = kwargs['colors'] if 'colors' in kwargs else ['gray','white']
1467    self.linestyle = kwargs['linestyle'] if 'linestyle' in kwargs else None
1468    self.thickness = kwargs['thickness'] if 'thickness' in kwargs else 0   
1469
1470  # --- Points -------------------------------------------------------------
1471
1472  @property
1473  def points(self): return self._points
1474
1475  @points.setter
1476  def points(self, points):
1477
1478    self._points = points
1479
1480    P = QPainterPath()
1481    for k,p in enumerate(points):
1482      if k:
1483        P.lineTo(self.x2scene(p[0]), self.y2scene(p[1]))
1484      else:
1485        P.moveTo(self.x2scene(p[0]), self.y2scene(p[1]))
1486
1487    self.setPath(P)
1488  
1489  # --- Color --------------------------------------------------------------
1490
1491  @property
1492  def colors(self): return self._color
1493
1494  @colors.setter
1495  def colors(self, C):
1496    self._color = {'fill': C[0], 'stroke': C[1]}
1497    self.setStyle()
1498
1499  # --- Thickness ----------------------------------------------------------
1500
1501  @property
1502  def thickness(self): return self._thickness
1503
1504  @thickness.setter
1505  def thickness(self, t):
1506    self._thickness = t
1507    self.setStyle()

class item: 
 12class item():
 13  """
 14  Item of the animation (generic class)
 15
 16  Items are the elements displayed in the :py:attr:`Animation2d.Qscene`. 
 17  This class provides a common constructor, conversions of positions
 18  to scene coordinates and styling of ``QAbstractGraphicsShapeItem`` 
 19  children.
 20
 21  Attr:
 22
 23    animation (:class:`Animation2d`): Parent animation.
 24
 25    name (str): Unique identifier of the item.
 26
 27    parent (:class:`item` *subclass*): Parent item, if any.
 28
 29    position ([float, float]): Position of the item. See each subclass for
 30      details.
 31
 32    zvalue (float): Z-value (stack order).
 33  """
 34
 35  def __init__(self, animation, name, **kwargs):
 36    """
 37    Generic item constructor
 38
 39    Args:
 40
 41      animation (:class:`Animaton2d`): The animation container.
 42
 43      name (str): Name of the item. It should be unique, as it is used as an
 44        identifier in the :py:attr:`Animation2d.item` dict.
 45
 46      parent (*QGraphicsItem*): The parent ``QGraphicsItem``.
 47
 48      zvalue (float): Z-value (stack order).
 49
 50      position ([float, float]): Position of the item. See each item's 
 51        documentation for a description.
 52
 53      draggable (bool): If True, the element will be draggable. (default: ``False``)
 54
 55      clickable (bool): *TO DO*
 56    """  
 57
 58    # Call the other item's constructor, if any
 59    super().__init__()
 60
 61    # --- Definitions
 62
 63    # Reference animation
 64    self.animation = animation
 65
 66    # Assign name
 67    self.name = name
 68
 69    self._parent = None
 70    self._behindParent = None
 71    self._position = [0,0]
 72    self._shift = [0,0]
 73    self._transformPoint = [0,0]
 74    self._orientation = None
 75    self._scale = None
 76    self._zvalue = None
 77    self._draggable = None
 78      
 79    # --- Initialization
 80
 81    if 'parent' in kwargs: self.parent = kwargs['parent']
 82    if 'behindParent' in kwargs: self.behindParent = kwargs['behindParent']
 83    if 'position' in kwargs: self.position = kwargs['position']
 84    if 'transformPoint' in kwargs: self.transformPoint = kwargs['transformPoint']
 85    if 'orientation' in kwargs: self.orientation = kwargs['orientation']
 86    if 'scale' in kwargs: self.scale = kwargs['scale']
 87    if 'zvalue' in kwargs: self.zvalue = kwargs['zvalue']
 88    if 'draggable' in kwargs: self.draggable = kwargs['draggable']
 89
 90  def x2scene(self, x):
 91    """
 92    Convert the :math:`x` position in scene coordinates
 93
 94    arg:
 95      x (float): The :math:`x` position.
 96
 97    returns:
 98      The :math:`x` position in scene coordinates.
 99    """
100    if self.parent is None:
101      return (x-self.animation.boundaries['x'][0])*self.animation.factor
102    else:
103      return x*self.animation.factor
104
105  def y2scene(self, y):
106    """
107    Convert the :math:`y` position in scene coordinates
108
109    arg:
110      y (float): The :math:`y` position.
111
112    returns:
113      The :math:`y` position in scene coordinates.
114    """
115    
116    if self.parent is None:
117      return (self.animation.boundaries['y'][0]-y)*self.animation.factor
118    else:
119      return -y*self.animation.factor
120
121  def xy2scene(self, xy):
122    """
123    Convert the :math:`x` and :math:`y` positions in scene coordinates
124
125    arg:
126      xy ([float,float]): The :math:`x` and :math:`y` positions.
127
128    returns:
129      The :math:`x` and :math:`y` position in scene coordinates.
130    """
131
132    return self.x2scene(xy[0]), self.y2scene(xy[1])
133
134  def d2scene(self, d):
135    """
136    Convert a distance in scene coordinates
137
138    arg:
139      d (float): Distance to convert.
140
141    returns:
142      The distance in scene coordinates.
143    """
144
145    return d*self.animation.factor
146
147  def a2scene(self, a):
148    """
149    Convert an angle in scene coordinates (radian to degrees)
150
151    arg:
152      a (float): Angle to convert.
153
154    returns:
155      The angle in degrees.
156    """
157
158    return -a*180/np.pi
159  
160  def scene2x(self, u):
161    """
162    Convert horizontal scene coordinates into :math:`x` position
163
164    arg:
165      u (float): The horizontal coordinate.
166
167    returns:
168      The :math:`x` position.
169    """
170
171    if self._parent is None:
172      return self.animation.boundaries['x'][0] + u/self.animation.factor
173    else:
174      return u/self.animation.factor
175
176  def scene2y(self, v):
177    """
178    Convert vertical scene coordinates into :math:`y` position
179
180    arg:
181      v (float): The horizontal coordinate.
182
183    returns:
184      The :math:`y` position.
185    """
186
187    if self._parent is None:
188      return self.animation.boundaries['y'][0] - v/self.animation.factor
189    else:
190      return -v/self.animation.factor
191
192  def scene2xy(self, pos):
193    """
194    Convert scene coordinates into :math:`x` and :math:`y` positions
195
196    arg:
197      pos ([float,float]): The position in scene coordinates.
198
199    returns:
200      The :math:`x` and :math:`y` positions.
201    """
202
203    if isinstance(pos, QPointF):
204      u = pos.x()
205      v = pos.y()
206    else:
207      u = pos[0]
208      v = pos[1]
209
210    return self.scene2x(u), self.scene2y(v)
211
212  def scene2d(self, d):
213   
214    return d/self.animation.factor
215
216  def width(self):
217
218    if isinstance(self, group):
219      bRect = self.childrenBoundingRect()
220    else:
221      bRect = self.boundingRect()
222
223    return bRect.width()/self.animation.factor
224
225  def height(self):
226
227    if isinstance(self, group):      
228      bRect = self.childrenBoundingRect()
229    else:
230      bRect = self.boundingRect()
231
232    return bRect.height()/self.animation.factor
233
234  def place(self):
235    """
236    Absolute positionning
237
238    Places the item at an absolute position.
239    
240    Attributes:
241      x (float): :math:`x`-coordinate of the new position. It can also be a 
242        doublet [``x``,``y``], in this case the *y* argument is 
243        overridden.
244      y (float): :math:`y`-coordinate of the new position.
245      z (float): A complex number :math:`z = x+jy`. Specifying ``z``
246        overrides the ``x`` and ``y`` arguments.
247    """
248
249    # Set position
250    self.setPos(self.x2scene(self._position[0])-self._shift[0], 
251      self.y2scene(self._position[1])-self._shift[1])
252
253  def move(self, dx=None, dy=None, z=None):
254    """
255    Relative displacement
256
257    Displaces the item of relative amounts.
258    
259    Attributes:
260      dx (float): :math:`x`-coordinate of the displacement. It can also be a 
261        doublet [`dx`,`dy`], in this case the *dy* argument is overridden.
262      dy (float): :math:`y`-coordinate of the displacement.
263      z (float): A complex number :math:`z = dx+jdy`. Specifying ``z``
264        overrides the ``x`` and ``y`` arguments.
265    """
266
267    # Doublet input
268    if isinstance(dx, (tuple, list)):
269      dy = dx[1]
270      dx = dx[0]  
271
272    # Convert from complex coordinates
273    if z is not None:
274      dx = np.real(z)
275      dy = np.imag(z)
276
277    # Store position
278    if dx is not None: self._position[0] += dx
279    if dy is not None: self._position[1] += dy
280
281    self.place()
282
283  def rotate(self, angle):
284    """
285    Relative rotation
286
287    Rotates the item relatively to its current orientation.
288    
289    Attributes:
290      angle (float): Orientational increment (rad)
291    """
292
293    self._orientation += angle
294    self.setRotation(self.a2scene(self.orientation))
295
296  def setStyle(self):
297    """
298    Item styling
299
300    This function does not take any argument, instead it applies the changes
301    defined by each item's styling attributes (*e.g.* color, stroke thickness).
302    """
303
304    # --- Fill
305
306    if isinstance(self, QAbstractGraphicsShapeItem):
307
308      if self._color['fill'] is not None:
309        self.setBrush(QBrush(QColor(self._color['fill'])))
310
311    # --- Stroke
312
313    if isinstance(self, (QAbstractGraphicsShapeItem,QGraphicsLineItem)):
314
315      Pen = QPen()
316
317      #  Color
318      if self._color['stroke'] is not None:
319        Pen.setColor(QColor(self._color['stroke']))
320
321      # Thickness
322      if self._thickness is not None:
323        Pen.setWidth(self._thickness)
324
325      # Style
326      match self._linestyle:
327        case 'dash' | '--': Pen.setDashPattern([3,6])
328        case 'dot' | ':' | '..': Pen.setStyle(Qt.DotLine)
329        case 'dashdot' | '-.': Pen.setDashPattern([3,3,1,3])
330      
331      self.setPen(Pen)
332
333  def mousePressEvent(self, event):
334    """
335    Simple click event
336
337    For internal use only.
338
339    args:
340      event (QGraphicsSceneMouseEvent): The click event.
341    """
342
343    match event.button():
344      case 1: type = 'leftclick'
345      case 2: type = 'rightclick'
346      case 4: type = 'middleclick'
347      case 8: type = 'sideclick'
348
349    self.animation.change(type, self)
350    super().mousePressEvent(event)
351
352  def mouseDoubleClickEvent(self, event):
353    """
354    Double click event
355
356    For internal use only.
357
358    args:
359      event (QGraphicsSceneMouseEvent): The double click event.
360    """
361
362    self.animation.change('doubleclick', self)
363    super().mousePressEvent(event)
364
365  def itemChange(self, change, value):
366    """
367    Item change notification
368
369    This method is triggered upon item change. The item's transformation
370    matrix has changed either because setTransform is called, or one of the
371    transformation properties is changed. This notification is sent if the 
372    ``ItemSendsGeometryChanges`` flag is enabled (e.g. when an item is 
373    :py:attr:`item.movable`), and after the item's local transformation 
374    matrix has changed.
375
376    args:
377
378      change (QGraphicsItem constant): 
379
380    """
381    # -- Define type
382
383    type = None
384
385    match change:
386      case QGraphicsItem.ItemPositionHasChanged:
387        type = 'move'
388
389    # Report to animation
390    if type is not None:
391      self.animation.change(type, self)
392
393    # Propagate change
394    return super().itemChange(change, value)
395

422  def position(self, pos):
423    
424    if isinstance(pos, complex):
425
426      # Convert from complex coordinates
427      x = np.real(pos)
428      y = np.imag(pos)
429
430    else:
431
432      # Doublet input
433      x = pos[0]  
434      y = pos[1]      
435
436    # Store position
437    self._position = [x,y]
438
439    # Set position
440    self.place()

451

454      y = np.imag(pt)
455
456    else:
457
458      # Doublet input
459      x = pt[0]  
460      y = pt[1]      
461
462    # Store transform point
463    self._transformPoint = [x,y]
464
465    # Set transform point
466    self.setTransformOriginPoint(self.x2scene(x), self.y2scene(y))

Absolute positionning

Places the item at an absolute position.

Attributes: x (float): \( x \)-coordinate of the new position. It can also be a doublet [x,y], in this case the y argument is overridden. y (float): \( y \)-coordinate of the new position. z (float): A complex number \( z = x+jy \). Specifying z overrides the x and y arguments.

def move(self, dx=None, dy=None, z=None): 
253  def move(self, dx=None, dy=None, z=None):
254    """
255    Relative displacement
256
257    Displaces the item of relative amounts.
258    
259    Attributes:
260      dx (float): :math:`x`-coordinate of the displacement. It can also be a 
261        doublet [`dx`,`dy`], in this case the *dy* argument is overridden.
262      dy (float): :math:`y`-coordinate of the displacement.
263      z (float): A complex number :math:`z = dx+jdy`. Specifying ``z``
264        overrides the ``x`` and ``y`` arguments.
265    """
266
267    # Doublet input
268    if isinstance(dx, (tuple, list)):
269      dy = dx[1]
270      dx = dx[0]  
271
272    # Convert from complex coordinates
273    if z is not None:
274      dx = np.real(z)
275      dy = np.imag(z)
276
277    # Store position
278    if dx is not None: self._position[0] += dx
279    if dy is not None: self._position[1] += dy
280
281    self.place()

Relative displacement

Displaces the item of relative amounts.

Attributes: dx (float): \( x \)-coordinate of the displacement. It can also be a doublet [dx,dy], in this case the dy argument is overridden. dy (float): \( y \)-coordinate of the displacement. z (float): A complex number \( z = dx+jdy \). Specifying z overrides the x and y arguments.

def setStyle(self): 
296  def setStyle(self):
297    """
298    Item styling
299
300    This function does not take any argument, instead it applies the changes
301    defined by each item's styling attributes (*e.g.* color, stroke thickness).
302    """
303
304    # --- Fill
305
306    if isinstance(self, QAbstractGraphicsShapeItem):
307
308      if self._color['fill'] is not None:
309        self.setBrush(QBrush(QColor(self._color['fill'])))
310
311    # --- Stroke
312
313    if isinstance(self, (QAbstractGraphicsShapeItem,QGraphicsLineItem)):
314
315      Pen = QPen()
316
317      #  Color
318      if self._color['stroke'] is not None:
319        Pen.setColor(QColor(self._color['stroke']))
320
321      # Thickness
322      if self._thickness is not None:
323        Pen.setWidth(self._thickness)
324
325      # Style
326      match self._linestyle:
327        case 'dash' | '--': Pen.setDashPattern([3,6])
328        case 'dot' | ':' | '..': Pen.setStyle(Qt.DotLine)
329        case 'dashdot' | '-.': Pen.setDashPattern([3,3,1,3])
330      
331      self.setPen(Pen)

Item styling

This function does not take any argument, instead it applies the changes defined by each item's styling attributes (e.g. color, stroke thickness).

def mousePressEvent(self, event): 
333  def mousePressEvent(self, event):
334    """
335    Simple click event
336
337    For internal use only.
338
339    args:
340      event (QGraphicsSceneMouseEvent): The click event.
341    """
342
343    match event.button():
344      case 1: type = 'leftclick'
345      case 2: type = 'rightclick'
346      case 4: type = 'middleclick'
347      case 8: type = 'sideclick'
348
349    self.animation.change(type, self)
350    super().mousePressEvent(event)

def itemChange(self, change, value): 
365  def itemChange(self, change, value):
366    """
367    Item change notification
368
369    This method is triggered upon item change. The item's transformation
370    matrix has changed either because setTransform is called, or one of the
371    transformation properties is changed. This notification is sent if the 
372    ``ItemSendsGeometryChanges`` flag is enabled (e.g. when an item is 
373    :py:attr:`item.movable`), and after the item's local transformation 
374    matrix has changed.
375
376    args:
377
378      change (QGraphicsItem constant): 
379
380    """
381    # -- Define type
382
383    type = None
384
385    match change:
386      case QGraphicsItem.ItemPositionHasChanged:
387        type = 'move'
388
389    # Report to animation
390    if type is not None:
391      self.animation.change(type, self)
392
393    # Propagate change
394    return super().itemChange(change, value)

Item change notification

This method is triggered upon item change. The item's transformation matrix has changed either because setTransform is called, or one of the transformation properties is changed. This notification is sent if the ItemSendsGeometryChanges flag is enabled (e.g. when an item is item.movable), and after the item's local transformation matrix has changed.

change (QGraphicsItem constant):

667  # --- Center -------------------------------------------------------------
668
669  @property
670  def center(self): return self._center
671
672  @center.setter
673  def center(self, C):
674
675    if isinstance(C, bool):
676      self._center = (C,C)
677    else:
678      self._center = C
679
680    self._shift = [0,0]
681    if self._center[0] or self._center[1]:
682      
683      bb = self.boundingRect()
684
685      if self.center[0]:
686        self._shift[0] = bb.width()/2
687      if self._center[1]:
688        self._shift[1] = bb.height()/2
689
690    self.place()

class ellipse(item, PyQt5.QtWidgets.QGraphicsEllipseItem): 
694class ellipse(item, QGraphicsEllipseItem):
695  """
696  Ellipse item
697
698  The ellipse is defined by it's :py:attr:`ellipse.major` and :py:attr:`ellipse.minor`
699  axis lenghts, and by its position and orientation. The position of the 
700  center is set by :py:attr:`item.position` and the orientation ... *TO WRITE*.
701  
702  Attributes:
703
704    major (float): Length of the major axis.
705
706    minor (float): Length of the minor axis.
707  """
708
709  def __init__(self, animation, name, **kwargs):
710    """
711    Ellipse item constructor
712
713    Defines an ellipse, which inherits both from ``QGraphicsEllipseItem`` and
714    :class:`item`.
715
716    Args:
717
718      animation (:class:`Animaton2d`): The animation container.
719
720      name (str): The item's identifier, which should be unique. It is used as a
721        reference by :class:`Animation2d`. This is the only mandatory argument.
722
723      parent (*QGraphicsItem*): The parent ``QGraphicsItem`` in the ``QGraphicsScene``.
724        Default is ``None``, which means the parent is the ``QGraphicsScene`` itself.
725
726      zvalue (float): Z-value (stack order) of the item.
727
728      orientation (float): Orientation of the item (rad)
729
730      position ([float,float]): Position of the ``group``, ``text``, 
731        ``circle``, and ``rectangle`` elements (scene units).
732
733      colors ([*color*, *color*]): Fill and stroke colors for ``circle``, 
734        ``ellipse``, ``rectangle`` or ``polygon`` elements.  Colors can be 
735        whatever input of ``QColor`` (*e.g*: ``darkCyan``, ``#ff112233`` or 
736        (255, 0, 0, 127))
737
738      linestyle (str): Stroke style (for ``circle``, ``ellipse``, ``rectangle``
739        or ``polygon``). Can have any value among ``solid`` (default), ``dash``
740        or ``--``, ``dot`` or ``..`` or ``:``, ``dashdot`` or ``-.``.
741
742      clickable (bool): *TO DO*
743
744      movable (bool): If True, the element will be draggable. (default: ``False``)
745    """  
746
747    # Generic item constructor
748    super().__init__(animation, name, **kwargs)
749    
750    # --- Definitions
751
752    self._major = None
753    self._minor = None
754    self._color = (None, None)
755    self._thickness = None
756    self._linestyle = None
757    self._span = None
758
759    # --- Initialization
760
761    if 'major' not in kwargs or 'minor' not in kwargs:
762      raise AttributeError("'major' and 'minor' must be specified for ellipse items.")
763    else:
764      self.major = kwargs['major']
765      self.minor = kwargs['minor']
766
767    self.colors = kwargs['colors'] if 'colors' in kwargs else ['gray','white']
768    self.linestyle = kwargs['linestyle'] if 'linestyle' in kwargs else None
769    self.thickness = kwargs['thickness'] if 'thickness' in kwargs else 0   
770    self.span = kwargs['span'] if 'span' in kwargs else None
771
772  # --- Major axis length --------------------------------------------------
773
774  @property
775  def major(self): return self._major
776
777  @major.setter
778  def major(self, major):
779
780    self._major = major
781
782    if self._minor is not None:
783
784      # Conversion
785      M = self.d2scene(self._major)
786      m = self.d2scene(self._minor)
787
788      # Set geometry
789      self.setRect(QRectF(-M/2, -m/2, M, m))
790
791  # --- Minor axis length --------------------------------------------------
792
793  @property
794  def minor(self): return self._minor
795
796  @minor.setter
797  def minor(self, minor):
798
799    self._minor = minor
800
801    # Conversion
802    M = self.d2scene(self._major)
803    m = self.d2scene(self._minor)
804
805    # Set geometry
806    self.setRect(QRectF(-M/2, -m/2, M, m))
807
808  # --- Colors -------------------------------------------------------------
809
810  @property
811  def colors(self): return self._color
812
813  @colors.setter
814  def colors(self, C):
815    self._color = {'fill': C[0], 'stroke': C[1]}
816    self.setStyle()
817
818  # --- Thickness ----------------------------------------------------------
819
820  @property
821  def thickness(self): return self._thickness
822
823  @thickness.setter
824  def thickness(self, t):
825    self._thickness = t
826    self.setStyle()
827
828  # --- Linestyle ----------------------------------------------------------
829
830  @property
831  def linestyle(self): return self._linestyle
832
833  @linestyle.setter
834  def linestyle(self, s):
835    self._linestyle = s
836    self.setStyle()      
837
838 # --- Span ----------------------------------------------------------------
839
840  @property
841  def span(self): return self._span
842
843  @span.setter
844  def span(self, span):
845    self._span = span
846    if span is None:
847      self.setStartAngle(0)
848      self.setSpanAngle(5760)
849    else:
850      self.setStartAngle(int(span[0]*2880/np.pi))
851      self.setSpanAngle(int(span[1]*2880/np.pi))

 990class rectangle(item, QGraphicsRectItem):
 991  """
 992  Rectangle item
 993
 994  The ellipse is defined by it's :py:attr:`ellipse.major` and :py:attr:`ellipse.minor`
 995  axis lenghts, and by its position and orientation. The position of the 
 996  center is set by :py:attr:`item.position` and the orientation ... *TO WRITE*.
 997  
 998  Attributes:
 999
1000    major (float): Length of the major axis.
1001
1002    minor (float): Length of the minor axis.
1003  """
1004
1005  def __init__(self, animation, name, **kwargs):
1006    """
1007    Rectangle item constructor
1008
1009    Defines an ellipse, which inherits both from ``QGraphicsEllipseItem`` and
1010    :class:`item`.
1011
1012    Args:
1013
1014      animation (:class:`Animaton2d`): The animation container.
1015
1016      name (str): The item's identifier, which should be unique. It is used as a
1017        reference by :class:`Animation2d`. This is the only mandatory argument.
1018
1019      parent (*QGraphicsItem*): The parent ``QGraphicsItem`` in the ``QGraphicsScene``.
1020        Default is ``None``, which means the parent is the ``QGraphicsScene`` itself.
1021
1022      zvalue (float): Z-value (stack order) of the item.
1023
1024      orientation (float): Orientation of the item (rad)
1025
1026      position ([float,float]): Position of the ``group``, ``text``, 
1027        ``circle``, and ``rectangle`` elements (scene units).
1028
1029      colors ([*color*, *color*]): Fill and stroke colors for ``circle``, 
1030        ``ellipse``, ``rectangle`` or ``polygon`` elements.  Colors can be 
1031        whatever input of ``QColor`` (*e.g*: ``darkCyan``, ``#ff112233`` or 
1032        (255, 0, 0, 127))
1033
1034      linestyle (str): Stroke style (for ``circle``, ``ellipse``, ``rectangle``
1035        or ``polygon``). Can have any value among ``solid`` (default), ``dash``
1036        or ``--``, ``dot`` or ``..`` or ``:``, ``dashdot`` or ``-.``.
1037
1038      clickable (bool): *TO DO*
1039
1040      movable (bool): If True, the element will be draggable. (default: ``False``)
1041    """  
1042
1043    # Generic item constructor
1044    super().__init__(animation, name, **kwargs)
1045    
1046    # --- Definitions
1047
1048    self._width = None
1049    self._height = None
1050    self._center = (True, True)
1051    self._color = (None, None)
1052    self._thickness = None
1053    self._linestyle = None
1054
1055    # --- Initialization
1056
1057    if 'width' not in kwargs or 'height' not in kwargs:
1058      raise AttributeError("'width' and 'height' must be specified for rectangle items.")
1059    else:
1060      self.width = kwargs['width']
1061      self.height = kwargs['height']
1062
1063    if 'center' in kwargs: self.center = kwargs['center']
1064    self.colors = kwargs['colors'] if 'colors' in kwargs else ['gray','white']
1065    self.linestyle = kwargs['linestyle'] if 'linestyle' in kwargs else None
1066    self.thickness = kwargs['thickness'] if 'thickness' in kwargs else 0   
1067
1068  def setGeometry(self):
1069
1070    # Conversion
1071    W = self.d2scene(self._width)
1072    H = self.d2scene(self._height)
1073
1074    dx = 0
1075    dy = 0
1076    if self._center[0] or self._center[1]:
1077      
1078      bb = self.boundingRect()
1079      if self._center[0]: dx = -W/2
1080      if self._center[1]: dy = H/2
1081
1082    # Set geometry
1083    self.setRect(QRectF(dx, dy, W, -H))
1084
1085  # --- Width --------------------------------------------------------------
1086

1089

1091  def width(self, w):
1092
1093    self._width = w
1094    if self._height is not None: self.setGeometry()
1095      
1096  # --- Height -------------------------------------------------------------
1097
1098  @property
1099  def height(self): return self._height
1100
1101  @height.setter
1102  def height(self, h):
1103
1104    self._height = h
1105    self.setGeometry()    
1106
1107  # --- Center -------------------------------------------------------------
1108
1109  @property
1110  def center(self): return self._center
1111
1112  @center.setter
1113  def center(self, C):
1114
1115    if isinstance(C, bool):
1116      self._center = (C,C)
1117    else:
1118      self._center = C
1119
1120    self.setGeometry()
1121

1123
1124  @property
1125  def colors(self): return self._color
1126
1127  @colors.setter
1128  def colors(self, C):
1129    self._color = {'fill': C[0], 'stroke': C[1]}
1130    self.setStyle()
1131

1133
1134  @property

1277  """
1278  Polygon item
1279
1280  The ellipse is defined by it's :py:attr:`ellipse.major` and :py:attr:`ellipse.minor`
1281  axis lenghts, and by its position and orientation. The position of the 
1282  center is set by :py:attr:`item.position` and the orientation ... *TO WRITE*.
1283  
1284  Attributes:
1285
1286    major (float): Length of the major axis.
1287
1288    minor (float): Length of the minor axis.
1289  """
1290
1291  def __init__(self, animation, name, **kwargs):
1292    """
1293    Polygon item constructor
1294
1295    Defines an ellipse, which inherits both from ``QGraphicsEllipseItem`` and
1296    :class:`item`.
1297
1298    Args:
1299
1300      animation (:class:`Animaton2d`): The animation container.
1301
1302      name (str): The item's identifier, which should be unique. It is used as a
1303        reference by :class:`Animation2d`. This is the only mandatory argument.
1304
1305      parent (*QGraphicsItem*): The parent ``QGraphicsItem`` in the ``QGraphicsScene``.
1306        Default is ``None``, which means the parent is the ``QGraphicsScene`` itself.
1307
1308      zvalue (float): Z-value (stack order) of the item.
1309
1310      orientation (float): Orientation of the item (rad)
1311
1312      position ([float,float]): Position of the ``group``, ``text``, 
1313        ``circle``, and ``rectangle`` elements (scene units).
1314
1315      colors ([*color*, *color*]): Fill and stroke colors for ``circle``, 
1316        ``ellipse``, ``rectangle`` or ``polygon`` elements.  Colors can be 
1317        whatever input of ``QColor`` (*e.g*: ``darkCyan``, ``#ff112233`` or 
1318        (255, 0, 0, 127))
1319
1320      linestyle (str): Stroke style (for ``circle``, ``ellipse``, ``rectangle``
1321        or ``polygon``). Can have any value among ``solid`` (default), ``dash``
1322        or ``--``, ``dot`` or ``..`` or ``:``, ``dashdot`` or ``-.``.
1323
1324      clickable (bool): *TO DO*
1325
1326      movable (bool): If True, the element will be draggable. (default: ``False``)
1327    """  
1328
1329    # Generic item constructor
1330    super().__init__(animation, name, **kwargs)
1331    
1332    # --- Definitions
1333
1334    self._points = None
1335    self._color = (None, None)
1336    self._thickness = None
1337    self._linestyle = None
1338
1339    # --- Initialization
1340
1341    if 'points' not in kwargs:
1342      raise AttributeError("'points' must be specified for polygon items.")
1343    else:
1344      self.points = kwargs['points']
1345
1346    self.colors = kwargs['colors'] if 'colors' in kwargs else ['gray','white']
1347    self.linestyle = kwargs['linestyle'] if 'linestyle' in kwargs else None
1348    self.thickness = kwargs['thickness'] if 'thickness' in kwargs else 0   
1349
1350  # --- Points -------------------------------------------------------------
1351
1352  @property
1353  def points(self): return self._points
1354
1355  @points.setter
1356  def points(self, points):
1357
1358    self._points = points
1359
1360    poly = []
1361    for p in self._points:
1362      poly.append(QPointF(self.x2scene(p[0]), self.y2scene(p[1])))
1363    self.setPolygon(QPolygonF(poly))

1373    self.setStyle()
